Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2008 12:57PM Doeface wrote: Hi Guys, My onco never told me about the Oncotype DX test... YOU MUST ASK FOR IT TO BE DONE! I thought it was so irresponsible, I am waiting for the test results and in the interim, seeking another medical oncologist... When I asked her why on earth there was no mention of such a test, she backpeddled into some defense that ' it wasn't that important '.  It is such an important test and if you are fortunate enough to qualify ( Node "0", ER+PR+) you should insist upon it.
Posts.Title: OncotypeDX score, please help! moodyk13 otter

Posts.Content: Nov 8, 2008 06:52PM Doeface wrote: Hi Cebal, With your path results, you qualify for the Oncotype DX test... go to www.genomichealth.com.  This test will give you the likelyhood of whether chemo would be effective or not... I have done a lot of research and only 5000/100,000 women with our results benefit from chemo, this will give you a score which will help you and the doctor conclude whether or not this horrible assault to the body is worth it... it is a new test and is covered by most insurance policies.  My onco didn't bother to mention it to me.. I am with a new onco now.  Good luck!
Posts.Title: Surgery's over, Now what? Firni lktracey
